Solar.Earth:
Earth
Diameter: 12742km Distance to sun: 150 millin km
Solar.Venus: Venus Diameter: 12104km Venus is the second planet from the Sun It has the longest rotation period: 243 days Rotates in the opposite direction to most other planets.
Solar.Mercury:
Mercury Diameter: 4879km The smallest and innermost planet in the Solar System.
Orbital period: 87.97 days, is the shortest of all the planets in the Solar System.
Solar.Mars: Mars Diameter: 12104km Mars is a terrestrial planet with a thin atmosphere It is the fourth planet from the Sun and the second-smallest planet. The reddish iron oxide prevalent on its surface gives it a reddish appearance
Solar.Jupiter: Jupiter Jupiter is a gas giant planet(139822km), primarily composed of hydrogen. The outer atmosphere is segregated into several bands, resulting in turbulence and storms. A prominent result is the Great Red Spot, a giant storm that is known to have existed since at least the 17th century
Solar.Saturn: Saturn Saturn is a gas giant with an average radius(116464km) about nine times that of Earth. The core of Saturn is surrounded by a deep layer of metallic hydrogen Wind speeds on Saturn can reach 1,800 km/h (1,100 mph), higher than on Jupiter
Solar.Uranus: Uranus The "ice giant". It has the coldest planetary atmosphere in the Solar System, with a minimum temperature of −224 °C It's axis of rotation is tilted sideways(97.77°), nearly into the plane of its solar orbit. Wind speeds can reach 900 km/h.
Solar.Neptune:
Neptune The densest giant planet in the solar system, one of the "ice giants".
Traces of methane in the outermost regions in part account for it's blue appearance. Neptune has the strongest wind (2100 km/h) in the solar system.
